comments.author: keepitsimplestupid@yahoo.com
comments.text:
Created attachment 543328
Save As Wrong Focus (firefox).jpg

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build ID: 20110615151330

Steps to reproduce:

I basicallly selected an image of any website, right clicked and did a save as and used keyboard navigation.  i.e. type the first letter of the file in the list


Actual results:

The focus changed to the sidebar section rather than the highlighted section.

Other similar dialogs are affected such as file uploads, like I used when submitting this bug.


Expected results:

It should have followed within the directory and not the parent directory.

Follow the steps 1,2 and 3 in the image.  Step 1 is not in red, sorry.
comments.creator: keepitsimplestupid@yahoo.com
comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build ID: 20110615151330

Steps to reproduce:

I basicallly selected an image of any website, right clicked and did a save as and used keyboard navigation.  i.e. type the first letter of the file in the list


Actual results:

The focus changed to the sidebar section rather than the highlighted section.

Other similar dialogs are affected such as file uploads, like I used when submitting this bug.


Expected results:

It should have followed within the directory and not the parent directory.

Follow the steps 1,2 and 3 in the image.  Step 1 is not in red, sorry.
Do you know if Firefox 3.6/4 behave the same by Chance?
comments.author: xtc4uall@gmail.com
comments.text: Do you know if Firefox 3.6/4 behave the same by Chance?

comments.raw_text:
FF 4 - Yes, behaved the same way

What I don't quite know is if this is a Win 7 phenomena.
